00058 void Preprocessor::optimalThreshold (const unsigned char &threshold)
00059 {
00060     if ( threshold < 0.0 )
00061         optimalThreshold_ = 0.0;
00062     else
00063     {
00064         if ( threshold > 1.0 )
00065             optimalThreshold_ = 1.0;
00066         else
00067             optimalThreshold_ = threshold;
00068     }
00069 };

00090 void Preprocessor::backgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const unsigned char &grayLevel)
00091 {
00092     if ( grayLevel < 0.0 )
00093         backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = 0.0;
00094     else
00095     {
00096         if ( grayLevel > 1.0 )
00097             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = 1.0;
00098         else
00099             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = grayLevel;
00100     }
00101 };

00153 unsigned char Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00154 {
00155     // Find background reference gray level
00156     findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip);
00157     optimalThreshold_ = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00158     unsigned char temporaryThreshold;
00159     
00160     do
00161     {
00162         // Compute the background and objects mean values
00163         unsigned int backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00164         unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00165         
00166         for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00167         {
00168             for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00169             {
00170                 // Get gray level of this pixel
00171                 unsigned char grayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(i,j);
00172                 
00173                 // Assume light gray values as the background
00174                 if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold_ )
00175                 {
00176                     backgroundMeanValue += grayLevel;
00177                     nSamples++;
00178                 }
00179                 else
00180                     objectsMeanValue += grayLevel;
00181             }
00182         }
00183         backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / nSamples);
00184         objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / (clip.nPixels() - nSamples));
00185                 
00186         // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00187         temporaryThreshold = optimalThreshold_;
00188         optimalThreshold_ = round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2);
00189     }
00190     while (temporaryThreshold != optimalThreshold_);
00191 
00192     return optimalThreshold_;
00193 };

00209 unsigned char Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00210 {
00211     // Compute clip histogram
00212     std::vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00213     
00214     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00215     {
00216         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00217         {
00218             // Get gray level of this pixel
00219             unsigned char grayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(i,j);
00220             
00221             // Update histogram
00222             histogram[grayLevel] += 1;
00223         }
00224     }
00225     
00226     
00227     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00228     std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00229     unsigned char moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0, levelCounter = 0;
00230     
00231     for (histogramIterator = histogram.begin(); histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end(); ++histogramIterator, ++levelCounter)
00232     {
00233         if ( *histogramIterator > histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel] )
00234             moreFrequentGrayLevel = levelCounter;
00235     }
00236     unsigned int referenceGrayLevel = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00237     
00238     
00239     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00240     std::vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( std::find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00241     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00242     unsigned int nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00243     
00244     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00245     {
00246         // Search forwards
00247         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00248         {
00249             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00250             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00251 
00252             ++histogramIterator;
00253         }
00254         
00255         // Search backwards
00256         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00257         {
00258             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00259             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00260             
00261             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00262         }
00263     }
00264     
00265     
00266     // Set the background reference gray level found
00267     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = round(referenceGrayLevel / nFrequencies);
00268     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00269 };

00287 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00288 {
00289     // Find background reference gray level
00290     findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip);
00291     
00292     
00293     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00294     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00295     {
00296         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00297         {
00298             unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00299 
00300             // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00301             for(int p = i-1; p < static_cast<int>(i+2); p++)
00302             {
00303                 for(int q = j-1; q < static_cast<int>(j+2); q++)
00304                 {
00305                     // Check clip borders
00306                     if ( (p < 0) or (p >= static_cast<int>(clip.height())) )
00307                         continue;
00308                     
00309                     if ( (q < 0) or (q >= static_cast<int>(clip.width())) )
00310                         continue;
00311                     
00312                     nPixels++;
00313                     
00314                     // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00315                     unsigned char neighbourPixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(p, q);
00316                     
00317                     // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00318                     if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel > optimalThreshold_) )
00319                         nBackgroundPixels++;
00320                     else
00321                     {
00322                         // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00323                         if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel < optimalThreshold_) )
00324                             nBackgroundPixels++;
00325                     }
00326                 }
00327             }
00328             
00329             // Adjust the isolated coefficient influence according to the number of neighbours found
00330             unsigned int realIsolationCoefficient = nPixels - 8 + (8 - isolationCoefficient);
00331 
00332             // Delete the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00333             if (nBackgroundPixels >= realIsolationCoefficient)
00334                 clip.setPixelGrayLevel(i, j, backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00335         }
00336     }
00337 };

00341 //
00342 // Otsu's algorithm for computing optimal threshold
00343 //
00344 
00345 // // Compute image histogram
00346 // std::vector<double> histogram(256, 0.0);
00347 // for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00348 // {
00349 //  for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00350 //  {
00351 //      // Get gray level of this pixel
00352 //      double grayLevel = clip.getPixel(i,j).grayLevel();
00353 //      
00354 //      // Update histogram
00355 //      histogram[std::floor(grayLevel * 255.0)] += 1.0;
00356 //  }
00357 // }
00358 // 
00359 // // Normalise histogram
00360 // std::transform( histogram.begin(), histogram.end(), histogram.begin(), std::bind1st(std::multiplies<double>(), 1.0 / static_cast<double>(clip.nPixels())) );
00361 // 
00362 // // Compute the zero- and first-order cumulative moments of the normalised histogram up to the kth level
00363 // std::vector<double> zeroMoments(256, 0.0), firstMoments(256, 0.0);
00364 // for ( unsigned int level = 0; level < 256; ++level )
00365 // {
00366 //  for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= (level+1); ++i )
00367 //  {
00368 //      zeroMoments[level]  += histogram[i-1];
00369 //      firstMoments[level] += histogram[i-1] * i;
00370 //  }
00371 // }
00372 // 
00373 // // Compute the total mean level of the image
00374 // double meanLevel = 0.0;
00375 // for ( unsigned int level = 1; level <= 256; ++level )
00376 //  meanLevel += histogram[level-1] * level;
00377 // 
00378 // // Compute the variance of the class separability at every gray level    
00379 // std::vector<double> variance(256, 0.0);
00380 // for ( unsigned int level = 0; level < 256; ++level )
00381 //  variance[level] = pow((meanLevel * zeroMoments[level]) - firstMoments[level], 2) / (zeroMoments[level] * (1 - zeroMoments[level]));
00382 //  
00383 // // Find the maximum value of variance
00384 // unsigned int level = 0;
00385 // double maxVariance = variance[0];
00386 // for ( std::vector<double>::iterator varianceIterator = variance.begin(); varianceIterator < variance.end(); ++varianceIterator, ++level )
00387 // {
00388 //  if ( *varianceIterator > maxVariance )
00389 //  {
00390 //      maxVariance = *varianceIterator;
00391 //      optimalThreshold_ = level;
00392 //  }
00393 // }
00394 // optimalThreshold_ = optimalThreshold_ / 255.0;
00395 // 
00396 // std::cout << "Optimal threshold with Otsu's method: " << optimalThreshold_ << std::endl;
